title: Fix ActiveMeditationPage UI and Back Button Positioning

requirements.text: In ActiveMeditationPage.tsx, apply `rounded-full` to the play/pause button so it renders as a perfect circle. Do not change its existing colors, background, hover effects, sizing, or any other styling.

quotes: make the play/pause button (XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/button[1]) fully circle-shaped by applying rounded-full

acceptanceCriteria: The play/pause button in ActiveMeditationPage.tsx has `rounded-full` applied
The button renders as a perfect circle
All existing colors, background, hover effects, and sizing are unchanged

requirements.text: In ActiveMeditationPage.tsx, remove vertical padding (py-*, pt-*, pb-*, padding-top, padding-bottom) from the parent wrapper containers that hold the volume control input and the time/seek control input, so that the inner input container's own padding is not doubled.

quotes: removing double vertical padding on control containers
Remove vertical padding from the two control input wrapper containers

acceptanceCriteria: The outer wrapper containers for the volume control and time/seek control inputs have no vertical padding classes (py-*, pt-*, pb-*)
There is no visual double-padding effect on these control sections
Inner input container padding is preserved

requirements.text: In ActiveMeditationPage.tsx, ensure the back button is always visible on all screen sizes. Remove any responsive hiding classes such as `hidden`, `sm:hidden`, `md:hidden`, `lg:hidden`, or any breakpoint-based display:none rules applied to it.

quotes: back button always visible on all screen sizes
ensure the back button that navigates to the previous page is always visible on all screen sizes

acceptanceCriteria: The back button in ActiveMeditationPage.tsx is visible on all screen sizes including large/desktop breakpoints
No responsive hiding classes (hidden, sm:hidden, md:hidden, lg:hidden, etc.) are applied to the back button
The back button's appearance and behavior match other pages (e.g. PreMeditationPage) where it is always visible

requirements.text: Fix the back button layout across the app so that on larger screens (before the hamburger menu kicks in), the back button sits visually below the header bar ('Logged In / Logout' or 'Exploring as Guest (Saved Locally) Return to Start') in the normal document flow. The fix must be layout/flow-based — not achieved via z-index. On smaller screens where the hamburger menu is active, the current correct behavior must be preserved.

quotes: back button is rendering on top of (overflowing) the 'Logged In / Logout' or 'Exploring as Guest' header containers. It should sit below those containers, not overlapping them
it should be below them visually and not with z-index below that container
fix the layout so the back button sits visually below the header bar in the document flow on larger screens, without any z-index tricks — just proper layout order

acceptanceCriteria: On larger screens (desktop), the back button appears visually below the session indicator header bar, not overlapping or on top of it
The fix is achieved through layout/document flow changes (e.g. removing absolute/fixed positioning that causes overlap, or adjusting layout structure) rather than z-index manipulation
On smaller screens where the hamburger menu is shown, the back button positioning remains correct as it currently is
The session indicator ('Logged In / Logout' or 'Exploring as Guest') is fully visible and not covered by the back button on any screen size

constraints: Do not change the play/pause button's colors, background, hover effects, or sizing — only add rounded-full
Back button positioning fix must be layout/flow-based, not z-index-based
Hamburger menu behavior on smaller screens must not be affected
nonGoals: Redesigning the ActiveMeditationPage layout beyond the specified fixes
Changing the session indicator (SessionIndicator) component's appearance or behavior
